sen.j: 両替町通（りょうがえまちどおり）は京都市内の南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Ryogaemachi-dori Street is a north-south running street in Kyoto city.
The Ryogaemachi-dori Street is a street running north-south through Kyoto city.
The Ryogaemachi-dori Street is a street running north-south through Kyoto city.

sen.j: 北は丸太町通から南は三条通まで、烏丸通の一筋西を走る。
sen.e: It extends from the Marutamachi-dori Street in the north to the Sanjo-dori Street in the south, running a block west of the Karasuma-dori Street.
It extends from Marutamachi-dori Street in north to Sanjo-dori Street in the south, running a block west of Karasuma-dori Street.
It extends from Marutamachi-dori Street in north to Sanjo-dori Street in the south, running a block west of Karasuma-dori Street.

sen.j: 南の延長線上を諏訪町通（すわんちょうどおり）が走る。
sen.e: The Suwancho-dori Street runs along its southern extension.
The Suwancho-dori Street runs along its southern extension.
The Suwancho-dori Street runs along its southern extension.
Origin and History
Origin and History
Origin and History

sen.j: 平安京には存在せず、豊臣秀吉による天正の地割で新設された通りである。
sen.e: It did not exist in Heiankyo and was built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI according to his Tensho zoning.
It did not exist in Heiankyo and was built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI according to his Tensho zoning policy.
It did not exist in Heiankyo and was built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI according to his Tensho zoning policy.

sen.j: 1600年（慶長5年）、押小路通との交差点付近に徳川家康によって金座 (歴史)が設けられ、さらに1608年（慶長13年）には銀座 (歴史)が伏見から金座の南に移転した。
sen.e: A kinza (history) was established by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA around the crossing with the Oshikoji-dori Street in 1600 and a ginza (history) was moved from Fushimi to an area south of the kinza in 1608.
A kinza (history) was established by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA around the intersection with Oshikoji-dori Street in 1600 and a ginza (history) was moved from Fushimi to an area south of the kinza in 1608.

A kinza (literally, gold za, or gold mint) was established by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA around the intersection with Oshikoji-dori Street in 1600 and a ginza (literally, silver za, or silver mint) was moved from Fushimi to an area south of the kinza in 1608.
sen.cmt: 金座、銀座の表記を修正

sen.j: このため通り沿いには金融や金銀細工に携わる業者が集中した。
sen.e: Therefore many financial dealers and gold- and silver-smiths were concentrated along the street.
Therefore many financial dealers and gold- and silver-smiths were concentrated along the street.
Therefore many financial dealers and gold- and silver-smiths were concentrated along the street.
Current Status
Current Status
Current Status

sen.j: 金融業は烏丸通に移り、現在は中心街の狭い通りである。
sen.e: Because financial institutions were relocated to the area along the Karasuma-dori Street, the current Ryogaemachi-dori Street is only a downtown narrow street.
Because financial institutions were relocated to the area along Karasuma-dori Street, the current Ryogaemachi-dori Street is only a narrow downtown street.
Because financial institutions were relocated to the area along Karasuma-dori Street, the current Ryogaemachi-dori Street is only a narrow downtown street.
Suwancho-dori Street
Suwancho-dori Street
Suwancho-dori Street

sen.j: 諏訪町通（すわんちょうどおり）は両替町通を南へ延長した線上にあり、北は高辻通から南は東本願寺の北端の花屋町通まで。
sen.e: The Suwancho-dori Street, located along the southern extension of the Ryogaemachi-dori Street, runs from the Takatsuji-dori Street in the north to the Hanayacho-dori Street at the northern end of Higashihongan-ji Temple in the south.

Suwancho-dori Street, located along the southern extension of the Ryogaemachi-dori Street, runs from Takatsuji-dori Street in the north to Hanayacho-dori Street at the northern end of Higashihongan-ji Temple in the south.

Suwancho-dori Street, located along the southern extension of the Ryogaemachi-dori Street, runs from Takatsuji-dori Street in the north to Hanayacho-dori Street at the northern end of Higashihongan-ji Temple in the south.

sen.j: 的場通との交差点付近にある諏訪神社が通り名の由来である。
sen.e: The name of the street comes from Suwa Jinja Shrine, which is near the crossing with the Matoba-dori Street.
The name of the street comes from Suwa Jinja Shrine, which is near the intersection with Matoba-dori Street.
The name of the street comes from Suwa-jinja Shrine, which is near the intersection with Matoba-dori Street.

sen.j: 六条通付近には江戸時代初期に「六条三筋町」の遊郭が設けられた。
sen.e: In the early Edo era brothels were established in Rokujo misujimachi around the Rokujo-dori Street
During the early Edo era brothels were established in Rokujo misujimachi around Rokujo-dori Street
During the early Edo period brothels were established in Rokujo misujimachi around Rokujo-dori Street
